intro: Carphalea angulata, commonly known as the angled carphalea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
